metadata.title: CVE-2014-1640 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
axiom-test.sh in axiom 20100701-1.1 uses tempfile to create a safetemporary file but appends a suffix to the original filename and writes tothis new filename, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary filesvia a symlink attack on the new filename.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

axiom - 20120501-17
axiom-databases - 20120501-17
axiom-graphics - 20120501-17
axiom-graphics-data - 20120501-17
axiom-hypertex - 20120501-17
axiom-hypertex-data - 20120501-17
axiom-source - 20120501-17
axiom-test - 20120501-17
axiom-tex - 20120501-17
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: axiom package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20120501-17').
